data.text: @Bruwulf Trust the gods of SCIENCE! Science is infallible and NEVER CHANGES you know!
@benheck You're lucky. I was feeling dreadfully sick for the first 48 hours, and I didn't feel "right" for a week. I'm terrified of my second shot in a week or so.
@benheck @William45811350 As someone who took the vaccine, you wouldn’t be doing the shooting. You’d be eating their brains.
@hobsonti @benheck I'm happy to base discussion on facts. Go.
@benheck Lol
@BAHSBenfield @benheck That's true, there was funding from the govt to help.
@benheck @David_67 They picked good and fast... cheap was out the window a while ago... c'mon man
@theguruofvoodoo Was done twice before as a movie, I Am Legend with Vincent Price and The Omega Man with Charlton Heston.
@benheck I liked the book better. Really good book compared to the movie. I also forget how War World Z started in the book also.
@William45811350 I dunno. The zombies might have a right to imminent domain. Especially if it's a "Bite Your Ground" state :)
@theguruofvoodoo Haha yeah and New York was equally as deserted in that movie! (the book took place in Santa Monica but nobody in CA walks so it already looks desolate)
@benheck Me either. But as zombies they would no longer be neighbors, but an invasive species.
@PalePrimate @benheck @Paulpoco It's only "bread and circuses" when it's two things people have been programed not the question.

@benheck @Paulpoco @ronscompvids While I agree with this in principle, Modi had the virus under control, and then he bowed to religious sentiments, allowing festivals (probably to keep people happy and save his political career).  Look at India two incubation weeks later.  It’s a disaster.
@benheck @DustinJerm I have a friend who felt nothing on dose 2 but everyone else including myself just felt a bit sick for a day. No big deal and now I can lick doorknobs again.
@benheck Wasn't this EXACTLY how "I Am Legend" started?
@chrisgarrett @Paulpoco @benheck It was great when it all began...
@ronscompvids @Paulpoco @benheck I bet the Rocky Horror night is fun
@chrisgarrett @Paulpoco @benheck It’s a lot of fun if you know all the words and don’t make a lot of direct eye contact.  No wait, that’s whatever was going on in ‘Eyes Wide Shut.’
@ronscompvids @Paulpoco @benheck True, I have not (and won’t) 😂
@chrisgarrett @Paulpoco @benheck You’ve obviously never been to a viewing of ‘The Sound of Music.’ https://t.co/yVzvIUseaP

@benheck @Paulpoco A friend of mine is a pharmacist who normally fills hundreds of scripts for the flu every year.  2020 maybe had them filling a dozen or more.

Americans could use a few more hand washings, mask wearings, and seatings behind plexiglass.

@benheck @ronscompvids Imperfect response based on past outbreaks and theory is better than no response or worse “it’s all fake to attack a bad president” but you keep using your platform to spread your Q-inspired comedy Ben 🤣

FWIW I had no idea the Atari 800 version of Space Harrier was so good!

@benheck @Paulpoco Governments did what they could to stop people from overwhelming hospitals. 

Critics will always cite methodology that worked as evidence that we “went too far.” I assure you, not a single person of the 3.2M dead think we should have did less.
@Paulpoco @benheck @ronscompvids People don’t sing, chant and shake hands at the movies.
@Paulpoco Good luck!
@Paulpoco @ronscompvids Nor gonna mince words, science be dammed you fire 60 million Americans and scare 300 million then close bars and churches? DICK MOVE. Shows no regard for mental health.
@benheck @ronscompvids There was a church here in Canada that was ordered closed for services due to covid19 but can be used for a Movie with 50 people inside.

@benheck @ronscompvids Am I paranoid when I use the stall plus urinal bathroom at work and lock the door when number 2 and don't want someone to walk in a use the urinal?   Since March of 2020 I have used that stall maybe 4 times now that I start from home and travel to different work sites.
@benheck This afternoon I go.
@benheck maybe 3 if the original process has a lot of padding.
@DustinJerm I've heard the 2nd dose can be worse. Guess I shall see! Puncture area is sore if I touch it, that's about it.
@benheck https://t.co/VE58OwCFPJ
@_the__Goat_ "Dwight said he has both sets of keys in case of emergency. So I asked What if you're dead Dwidht? He said If I'm dead, the rest of you died months ago"

@benheck I got my second dose on Tuesday and had the full gamut of side effects. Chills, fever, joint pain, muscle aches, nausea, headache. Headache finally went away yesterday. Should be noted I have RA and am on immunosuppressant.
@ronscompvids Right but contract transmission has been ruled out. Again, it was Toilet Seat AIDS 2.0 Speaking of religion the hand sanitizing stations were very much like holy water.
@benheck No side effects you say?  That is just what zombie Ben Heck would say!

@benheck I certainly don’t think you are a denier.  But for the record, only once at Home Depot was only once forced to sit, singing, in a single file line ten rows deep while someone forced me to touch a bowl of money being passed around.  I now only shop at Menards.
@David_67 Good fast or cheap pick two.
@benheck I was in a vaccine trial and talked with the investigator at length. It wasn't rushed. The trials were streamlined and labs kept open 24/7 which enabled the compressed timeline

@ronscompvids That's the thing I think people have missed with all my complaining. I'm not a COVID denier, I'm saying our safety measures are stupid and probably made things WORSE. Who cares if churches are closed when everyone crams into Home Depot during lockdown?
@benheck People love security theater almost as much as they love doughnut theater.  Both are pretty effective in keeping germs out of the dough. https://t.co/C1YYdhsAnw
@benheck https://t.co/9EfyQ8zb5R
@William45811350 I really have no desire to shoot my neighbors.
@ronscompvids Right but that was real science. Most of the COVID precautions based on fear and guesswork. For instance, thinking air can't move around a 2 foot wide barrier... That's not science.
@tojoski Had a friend experience that.

@benheck Science did just fly a helicopter on Mars, so some bowing might be owed.

When most folks lose their car keys, they enlist everyone’s help to find them.  No one then stands in the driveway refusing to get in the car because the search was “rushed.”
@benheck I've been waiting over a year for zombies now. HIGHLY disappointed. 1 out of 5 stars, would not recommend.
@benheck The pharmacist told me that the side effects seem worse in those people that had already had the virus.
@ronscompvids Lipstick on chimps haha. It's still rushed. I'm not bowing to science, covid, the vaccine etc like some of of Golden Calf. I will always be skeptical.
@CrosseyeJack We will be the new gods! Congress people who can't even change a tire will bow to US!

@benheck The folks who keep saying “rushed” in reference to the vaccine seem to be ignoring the fact that entire biomed industry stopped putting lipstick on chimpanzees for 8 months and focused all their research to this one goal.
@benheck A zombie apocalypse is a perfect world for portable consoles, using computer vision for automated gun turrents, etc. the makers shall inherit the earth... :-P
@benheck What could possibly go wrong...
@benheck You saying you don't want an IRL zombie movie?
@benheck Tomorrow never knows unless it was yesterday
